1.name: Tokyo Jujutsu High
1.description: Educational institution in Japan dedicated to training the next generation of jujutsu masters.

2.name: Kyoto Jujutsu High
2.description: Educational institution in Japan dedicated to training the next generation of jujutsu masters.

3.name: Zenin Clan
3.description: A lineage of sorcerers known for their exclusive possession of the Ten Shadows Technique.

4.name: Gojo Clan
4.description: A lineage of descendants of Sugawara known for their exclusive possession of the Infinite Technique and Six Eyes.

5.name: Kamo Clan
5.location_data: Traditional seat of the Kamo family
5.description: A lineage of sorcerers known for their exclusive possession of the Blood Manipulation Technique.

6.name: Inumaki Clan
6.location_data: Operates in secrecy, various hidden location
6.description: A lineage of sorcerers from the Jujutsu Kaisen universe known for their exclusive possession of the Cursed Speech Technique.

7.name: Suguru Geto’s Group
7.location_data: Temple hideout in Tokyo; operations in Shinjuku & Kyoto
7.description: His goal was to eradicate those who were not sorcerers, planning an assault on Tokyo, the pinnacle of the jujutsu world.

8.name: Mahito’s Group
8.description: Their ultimate goal is the eradication of humanity and  replacing the population with cursed spirits.

9.name: Time Vessel Association
9.location: House of the Children of the Star
9.description: A non-sorcerer religious organization in the Jujutsu Kaisen world that worships the immortal sorcerer Master Tengen as their deity

10.name: Q
10.description: An association with the goal of making Tengen lose all reason and thus reversing the current world of jujutsu.

11.name: Jujutsu Headquarters
11.description: The high council of sorcery in Japan, overseeing all jujutsu activities and schools.

12.name: Culling Games
12.location_data: Tokyo (with Colonies No. 1 and No. 2), the Sendai Colony, and the Sakurajima Colony (in Kagoshima Prefecture).
12.description: A macabre competition where sorcerers and non-sorcerers fight in a battle royale across Japan, with the goal of accumulating negative energy so that Kenjaku can transcend humanity.

13.name: Independent
13.description: Sorcerers, cursed users, or non-cursed users who work alone

14.name: Sukuna's Followers
14.description: They seek to restore Sukuna to its former glory and “golden age.”

15.name: Gachinko Fight Club
15.description: It is a place where sorcerers can earn money through combat and betting.

16.name: Kenjaku's Group
16.description: They seek to force the evolution of humanity through the optimization of cursed energy and fusion with Master Tengen.

17.name: The Hei
17.description: Elite Zenin unit, semi–grade 1 or higher, strongest clan group.

18.name: Kukuru Unit
18.description: Zenin males without innate techniques, forced into harsh martial arts training.

19.name: The Akashi
19.description: Zenin sorcerers with techniques, but too weak to join the Hei.

20.name: Fukuoka Branch Campus
20.description: Educational institution in Japan dedicated to training the next generation of jujutsu masters.

21.name: Suguru Geto's Cursed Spirit Manipulation
21.description: The curses that form part of Geto's curse manipulation technique, ready to attack under his command whenever he wishes.

22.name: Kenjaku's Cursed Spirit Manipulation
22.description: The curses that form part of Kenjaku's curse manipulation technique, ready to attack under his command whenever he wishes.
